questionsData.title: One of the common alkali is lemon .
Heating the solid makes the particles move more quickly.
Cloth is a kind of animal coverings.
Round, square , straight and curved are coverings .
Peak is the highest part of a mountain.
"Grazing" means "chewing the cud" .
Microscopes are made of concave lenses.
We see most things by refraction.
In famine, people die of hunger.
" Exploits" means" dangerous".
Childhood is the early part of person's life.
AIDS is developed from the blood of central African monkeys.
Amount of money as pay is duty.
A person who applies for a job is an applicant.
The layout of any text is called a design.
Kayak is a well-known food.
Things you use in cooking are ingredients.
"Harvest" means "to take from trees".
Lunar eclipse is the moon eclipse.
The cabin is a small house in which you live.
questionsData.explain_answer:
Cabin (ship) a small, enclosed room on a ship used for passengers or crew.
May have beds, furniture, and storage space.
Not a permanent residence, but provides living quarters for a journey.

questionsData.title: The text is mainly talking about Robert Boyle’s ............
questionsData.article: The Anglo-Irish scientist Robert Boyle began as an alchemist and became the first modern chemist. He was born in Ireland in 1627.He studied philosophy and mathematics in England, Afterwards, he traveled in France and Italy then he taught at Oxford University. At first he believed in alchemy, but soon he started to think differently, He began to study substances more scientifically. In the late 1650s, he discovered elements or the basic substances that things are made of. This discovery opened the way for modern chemistry’.In 1662, Boyle made another important invention, now called Boyle’s law or gas law, which states that the pressure and volume of a gas have an inverse relationship. If the volume increases, the pressure decreases and vice versa. In his later years, Boyle was mostly interested in philosophy and religion, He died in 1691.

Sana'a, …… I live is my best city

While she ………. in Hajja, she helped many people.

Give me two bottles of milk. The word "milk" is a/ an …..
To change the word" reason " into an adjective , we add ….
Have your children …… their hands every day …
questionsData.explain_answer:
Use of have/get + infinitive

You use these verbs to replace other instruction words such as ask, tell or order.

Example:

Ask the boy to put away his bag.
→    Have the boy put away his bag.
→    Get the boy to put away his bag.
Note: With have, the infinitive is without to.
